messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go-tour

LGTM



On Mon, Jun 17, 2013 at 8:49 PM, <adg@golang.org> wrote:

> Reviewers: golang-dev1,
>
> Message:
> Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,
>
> I'd like you to review this change to
> https://code.google.com/p/go-**tour <https://code.google.com/p/go-tour>
>
>
> Description:
> go-tour: fix link markup
>
> Please review this at https://codereview.appspot.**com/10367044/<https://codereview.appspot.com/10367044/>
>
> Affected files:
>   M tour.article
>
>
> Index: tour.article
> ==============================**==============================**=======
> --- a/tour.article
> +++ b/tour.article
> @@ -694,7 +694,7 @@
>
>  The evaluation of `f`, `x`, `y`, and `z` happens in the current goroutine
> and the execution of `f` happens in the new goroutine.
>
> -Goroutines run in the same address space, so access to shared memory must
> be synchronized. The `[[http://golang.org/pkg/sync/**][sync]]`<http://golang.org/pkg/sync/%5D%5Bsync%5D%5D>package provides useful primitives, although you won't need them much in Go
> as there are other primitives. (See the next slide.)
> +Goroutines run in the same address space, so access to shared memory must
> be synchronized. The [[http://golang.org/pkg/sync/]**[`sync`<http://golang.org/pkg/sync/%5D%5Bsync>]]
> package provides useful primitives, although you won't need them much in Go
> as there are other primitives. (See the next slide.)
>
>  .play prog/goroutines.go
>
>
>
> --
>
> ---You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google
> Groups "golang-dev" group.
> To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an
> email to golang-dev+unsubscribe@**googlegroups.com<golang-dev%2Bunsubscribe@googlegroups.com>
> .
> For more options, visit https://groups.google.com/**groups/opt_out<https://groups.google.com/groups/opt_out>
> .
>
>
>

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go-tour/source/detail?r=372af84498ad ***

go-tour: fix link markup

R=golang-dev, bradfitz
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/10367044

subject: code review 10367044: go-tour: fix link markup
